home.title: Age of Innovation Solo Helper
home.play1: Play the Automa Solo Mode of Age of Innovation.
home.play2: This helper application replaces the Automa card deck, manages the difficulty levels and Automa faction abilities.

players.title: Player
players.twoPlayerBotFaction: When playing with two players, the official rules only allow to play with The Simpletons.

setupGameAutoma.title: Automa Setup
setupGameAutoma.generalSetupIntro: Set up the game as usual, but with the following changes:
setupGameAutoma.roundScoreTiles: Use the double-sided Automa Round Score tiles instead of those from the multiplayer game. Flip the Automa Round Score tile to the side that shows the relevant round with a light marking. As In the base game, the Round Score tile with the Spade on its left side cannot be placed In Round 5 or 6.
setupGameAutoma.gameEndToken: Use the Automa Final Round Score tiles instead of those from the multiplayer game. Place a random tile as usual.
setupGameAutoma.palaceTiles: Place only 2 random Palace tiles next to the game board. Place Palace tile #17 (with the red back) next to them.

factionSelection.title: Choose your Faction as follows:
factionSelection.planningDisplayCards: Lay out 3 random Planning Display cards.
factionSelection.factionTiles: Add 2 random Faction tiles to each of these Planning Display cards.
factionSelection.chooseSet: Choose a set, take the corresponding Planning display, and select one of the two Factions.

setupGameAutoma.chooseAutomaTerrain: Choose a Native terrain for Automa different from yours. Give Automa the matching Automa Terrain Priority (ATP) card. The ATP's Terrain type is Indicated by the top and bottom bars and the leftmost circles.

automaComponents.title: Distribute the Automa components as follows:
automaComponents.buildings: Place all her buildings in her play area.
automaComponents.scholars: Place all her Scholars in her play area.
automaComponents.science: Place 1 of her Status markers on each of the spaces marked O on the Science display. Advance on these disciplines:
automaComponents.factionSetup: Follow the additional setup instructions on the {faction} Automa Faction card and familiarize yourself with the special rules.
automaComponents.scoreTrack: Place 1 of her Status markers on space 20 of the Score track
automaComponents.turnOrder: Place her Turn Order marker below your marker on the Turn Order display.

initialWorkshop.title: Placement of the First Workshops
initialWorkshop.intro: Automa places her initial Workshops after you place your first Workshop. Use the side of the Initial Workshop Setup card that shows the corresponding side of the game board.
initialWorkshop.marked: Place an Automa Workshop on the Native terrain space with letter {character}, together with a power token.
initialWorkshop.unmarked: Place an Automa Workshop on the Native terrain space with letter {character}.

bonusCards.title: Round Bonus
bonusCards.take: Shuffle the {count} Round Bonus tiles and place them face-up in a horizontal line. Give Automa the first one. Then choose your own Round Bonus tile.
bonusCards.coins: Place 1 Coin on each of the leftover Round Bonus tiles.

income.title: Income
income.collect: Collect new Workers, Coins, Priests and Power.

playerTurn.text: Please make your turn - or pass.
playerTurn.passInfo: Collect your round bonus victory points (if any) and take a new Bonus card.

gainVictoryPoints.text: Automa gains {count} victory point. | Automa gains {count} victory points.

validSpaces.marked: Withing Range of any marked Structure
validSpaces.marked-reaching: Withing Range of any marked Structure (with Reaching)
validSpaces.unmarked: Withing Range of any unmarked Structure
validSpaces.unmarked-reaching: Withing Range of any unmarked Structure (with Reaching)

tiebreaker.title: Select Space:
tiebreaker.terrainPriorityYourTerrainType: Terrain Priority {terrainPriority} with ATP card of your terrain type.
tiebreaker.structureClosest: Space closest to any of your Structures.

execute.title: Execute:
execute.homeTerrainTile: Place an Automa Home Terrain tile (if transforming was required).
execute.marked: Mark the new Workshop by placing a Power token on its space.

reaching.title: Reaching
reaching.text1: If none of the marked Structures are adjacent (directly or indirectly) to any of the unmarked Structures the valid spaces are further limited to only those that would decrease the current shortest distance between marked and unmarked structures.
reaching.text2: If there are none that would decrease it, all the spaces previously identified remain valid.

tiebreaker.title: Choose structure:
tiebreaker.tradingHouse: If Automa has a Trading house available: Automa Workshops adjacent to any of your Structures. Otherwise, any Structure that Automa can upgrade.
tiebreaker.littlePower: Giving you as little Power as possible.

execute.title: Execute:
execute.highestPowerStructure: Replace the chosen Structure with the highest Power value Structure it can be legally upgraded to.

blockPowerBookAction.gameBoard: Block one uncovered power action on game board
blockPowerBookAction.gameBoardExecute: Execute: Place an Action token on the selected Power action. Automa gains no benefit from this.

advanceScienceDiscipline.factionDruids: Automa advances 2 spaces on a single track (without placing a Priest).
advanceScienceDiscipline.factionPowerMongers: Ongoing Benefit: Whenever you gain 2 or more Power via structures, Automa advances 1 space on a Cult track (Cult Catch-up action without placing a Priest).
advanceScienceDiscipline.notMarker10: Automa advances only on tracks without a Marker on space 10.

scoringTile.title: Prefer cult track matching the color of the Automa icon on current Scoring tile.

catchUp.title: Use Catch-Up selection:
catchUp.marketAt0: The Cult track where Automa‘s Marker is at 0.
catchUp.highestMarker: The Cult track where Automa‘s Marker is nearest to your Marker; it can be on the same space or above or below you.
catchUp.highestMarkerMultipleHumans: The Cult track, where Automa‘s Marker is nearest to the highest Marker; it can be on the same space or above or below the other marker.

execute.title: Execute:
execute.placePriest: Place an available Automa Priest on the highest numbered Priest space below the chosen track and advance Automa‘s Marker the corresponding number of spaces.
execute.noPriest: If Automa has no more available Priests, or if there’s no empty Priest space available below the track, advance Automa‘s Marker by 1 on that track without placing a Priest.

takeInnovation.selectCultFavorTile: Take one of the +3 Cult Favor tiles for Cult tracks without a Marker on space 10.
takeInnovation.execute: Execute: Give the chosen tile to Automa and increase her Marker by 3 on the track shown on the tile.

factionSymbiontsPlaceCube.validSpaces: Valid Spaces: All Terrain spaces directly adjacent to any of your structures.
factionSymbiontsPlaceCube.symbiontYouthATP: Terrain Priority {terrainPriority} with Symbiont youth ATP card.
factionSymbiontsPlaceCube.placeCube: Place a worker cube on the selected Terrain space.

botPass.title: Automa passes.
botPass.scoringTile: Automa gains a fixed number of Victory points as shown in the lower right corner of the current Scoring tile.
botPass.scoringTileFactionRacelings: Racelings: Automa passed first this round and gains the fixed number of Victory Points on the current Scoring tile again.
botPass.bonusCardGold: If there are any coins on the Bonus card return them to the general supply.

endOfRound.title: End of Round
endOfRound.bonusCardsCoin: Put 1 Coin on each of the three leftover Bonus Cards.
endOfRound.removeScoringTile: Remove current scoring tile from board.

endOfGame.title: End of Game
endOfGame.cultScoring: Automa gains victory points from Cult scoring.
endOfGame.areaScoring: Automa gains victory points from Area scoring.
endOfGame.factionWanderers: Wanderers: Gain 1 victory point per structure anywhere on the board.
endOfGame.factionGognomes: Gognomes: Ensure Gognomes got victory points for their achievements.
endOfGame.resourceScoring: Automa doesn't get any points from Resource scoring.

action.abortGameConfirm: Aborting the running game - are you sure?
action.endGameConfirm: End this game and return to home screen - are you sure?

serviceWorkerUpdatedRefresh.title: Refresh Application
serviceWorkerUpdatedRefresh.notice: The application was updated - do you want to refresh to use the latest version?
